body.p:
Frankfort, Ky Oct. 26th 1863
Hon Gov of the State of Kentucky
Dear Sir

The undersigned respectfull asks you to Grant him a pardon so that I may become a useful man to my friends & family, in 1859, I was convicted in the circuit court, of, Harrison County for the term of four years, for Stealing a horse, I was Drunk and had no intention of stealing the hourse, I have caught the hourse on the road, with his saddle on his back and road him to, town, I have been good prisoner and refer to Mr. Whitesides, or any of the other Keepers my term expires on Sunday 29th of Nov
Engles has been a well behaved man in prison and that far is I think intitled to Executive clemency

Pardon
Harrison Cir Ct
vs
Patrick Engles
Pardoned
28th Nov/ 63

Pardon granted to be sent up to H. I. Todd
Tho E Bramlette

Hon Gov of State of Kentucky
Rd of Capt. H I Todd Keeper
